data.text: @PeterAlanRoss So sad
@PeterAlanRoss @OlgaWojtas Was told by sports ed about a possible feature - ‘it doesn’t have to be Scottish, it just has to be interesting’ - incredibly refreshing after parochialism of London media.
@Ian_Fraser @BBCDouglasF @PeterAlanRoss @soothron @PhilipJEMiller @LizzieCarrEllis I got to go Gretna

@PeterAlanRoss Do you think its alienating virtually all #indy supporting people and being seen to be doing its best to be a Unionist shill had anything to do with its demise, or is it the Scottish reading public's fault?

@PeterAlanRoss 🎩🙂

https://t.co/8BJLENaG1U
@timabrahams @PeterAlanRoss Seconded - my university degree is effectively useless but my time at the Sunday Herald made my so-called career.
@BernyMcgurk Yes, that's very true. A bunch of wee hairy Scots in the blue lagoon.
@PeterAlanRoss And Iceland with Mogwai.
@PeterAlanRoss Ah, but for one stupid photo!
@bonaldi @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss True. My first trip to Canada was via the Sunday Herald - and Richard gave it up so I could go. I think that's the only time an editor has ever done that.
@BBCDouglasF @PeterAlanRoss @soothron @PhilipJEMiller @Ian_Fraser I don't even know where Pennan is. Why was a Geordie ever hired????
@soothron @PhilipJEMiller @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss And I can now drive along the M8 in my sleep. Which I often did.
@LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss We did go on quite a few travel features too, I seem to remember. :)

@PeterAlanRoss Not surprised with a life like that!!
Shame about all the coverage they gave to Ian Brady’s death - that’s when I stopped buying.
@timabrahams @PeterAlanRoss Another star right here

@PeterAlanRoss For me, The Sunday Herald came far closer to the ideal of a learning place than my university. I met world class writers, reporters and editors there who gave me their time when they had so little of it to spare. I’m glad I left when I did but I’m still very sad to see it go.
@ToomuchMorgans @PeterAlanRoss Scotland has a small population for so many newspapers now that print media is dwindling.
@PeterAlanRoss Christ, no wonder it ran out of money!!
@PeterAlanRoss @soothron @PhilipJEMiller @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser I got to go to Pennan once.
@PeterAlanRoss I Don’t know one person that bought it !
@randallwrites @DameDeniseMina @PeterAlanRoss I have never enjoyed Phan-Ease as much as I do at this very moment 😂
@randallwrites @PeterAlanRoss Always imagine someone ringing the Sunday herald and only realising it was a stupid joke AS THEY SAID IT
@DameDeniseMina @PeterAlanRoss Phan-Ease…. *sniggers forever*

@PeterAlanRoss This is what I thought working in papers would be like. Got my first job on one in 2008, have worked at most in Scotland since and never seen anything like this. Envious of those who did, sad for us who didn't, sorry to see SH go. Loved working there despite these days being gone

@PeterAlanRoss They gave me a weekly column for no good reason. Kirsty Farquhar-Cox’s brave battle against mild cystitis ended when she was prescribed the wonder drug Phan-Ease and people called the paper to find out who made it.
Signed off KFC every week
@stephenpenman @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss I think you answered that a few tweets ago with the thing about making black even more black
@soothron @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Well, I went for goth. And he hired me. God alone knows what insight into my ability to work on a sports desk he was looking for though.
@ToomuchMorgans @PeterAlanRoss What she said
@Jolloy23 If that's the choice I'm a goth. Must have been the right answer because he hired me.
@stephenpenman @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Actually, thinking about it, I’m really interested in how you answered that, Stephen 😂
@PeterAlanRoss @stephenpenman @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser Yeh, I fondly remember Stephen’s Wayne Hussey hat and Bob Smith jumper
@soothron @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Sunday Herald production heroes all. 40 hour day Fri/Sat it was the best of times the worst of times...

@PeterAlanRoss @fidhlear True, but on here we now find out more than we used to in print. Media told us everything was fine and we believed it.
Now media in UK says one thing and it's so easy to disprove. That's why I think newsprint doesn't have a future, or in fact digital copies of it.
@stephenpenman @soothron @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser You'd think he could tell by looking.

@PhilipJEMiller @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Chris Donald from Viz wrote eloquently in his autobiography about ending up unable to tell where Viz ended and he began. At my absolute worst, I was like that about the Sunday. I wouldn’t change a moment of it, but I’m glad I got some perspective over time
@soothron @PhilipJEMiller @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser Ach, we were young. We could take it.
@soothron @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss My interview was weird. The first question Andrew Japan asked me? "So, tell me, Stephen. Are you a goth or a ned?"

@PhilipJEMiller @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss We did. Looking back at then from now, I realise we worked unhealthily hard; that we were — dare I say it — slightly cultish about it? But hey, we all got out unscathed. I think.
@ToomuchMorgans @fidhlear No problem. Politics is tricky anyway, and trickier on here.
@soothron @LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss You all worked incredibly hard on a paper you cared about deeply. And a remarkable newspaper for lots of reasons.
@PeterAlanRoss @ToomuchMorgans Agreed, but when politics means life  death to your family it has to come first.
@PeterAlanRoss @fidhlear Sorry Peter, last tweet wasn't aimed at you. Respect your right not to get involved with my question. Was replying to someone else in thread.
@fidhlear @ToomuchMorgans For you and others, yes, sure. But there is loads of good stuff in newspapers beyond politics. I think that gets lost in discussions about the press.

@LizzieCarrEllis @Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Subs? *Subs*? Page editors, surely. Totally different thing, so it was impressed upon me at interview. Despite the fact that we spent 70-odd* hours a week, er, subbing 😂

* Very odd
@fidhlear @PeterAlanRoss @WingsScotland had a post about the Herald/Sunday Herald and it included great investigative journalism. Just wondered when they went from that, to modern copy.
@PeterAlanRoss @ToomuchMorgans Quite understand, but when Sunday Herald came out for Indy it was a reason to buy newsprint again.
@Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss Such is a sub's life. To endlessly dream about what should be…
@Ian_Fraser @PeterAlanRoss And us subs went to the canteen 🙁
@PeterAlanRoss Not kind at all. Factual. And I tried to nab your Herald job once! Failed, of course!!
@adamleepotter Thank you. That's very kind.

@PeterAlanRoss So strange we never met, back in the day. I always admired your work. Despite that intro! And I mean that sweetly. Because I treasure and remember it. Unforgettable. And that's good. You've left a mark. And that's what journalists should do, surely?
@PeterAlanRoss No worries.
@ToomuchMorgans I don't have any inside knowledge of the decision to close. I'd prefer not to get into the politics, if you don't mind.
@PeterAlanRoss So in you're opinion, what went wrong and when? Was it indyref?

@PeterAlanRoss I will never, ever forget your Dougray Scott interview for the Herald! The intro was priceless! The real slim shady one. Newspapers, though, eh? We're basically dinosaurs, mate. Sadly. Such a shame. The people will miss us, I think, in the end. And then it will be too late.
@PeterAlanRoss Felt the same - not many seem to be remembering its culture output. All the snarky schadenfreude seems to be about particular news stories/reporters.

@PeterAlanRoss I agree it was a blast, with an international outlook and section editors and reporters given an unusual amount of freedom to report on things as they saw fit. I went to New York, San Francisco, Paris and Gdansk on stories.
@PeterAlanRoss I described it in almost exactly the same way to someone the other day. Had an idea, crazy though it might be? Give it a whirl.
